channel.title: math.MG updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.MG updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Families of lattices with an unbounded number of unit vectors
item.description: arXiv:2410.16172v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: 3 families of 4-dimensional lattices $L_k, M_k, M_k / 2 \subset \mathbb{R}^2$ are defined. Each lattice is defined by 2 quadratic extensions and has a \emph{finite} number of unit vectors, but the number of unit vectors in each of the 3 familes is \emph{unbounded}. $L_3$ is the Moser lattice.
item.dc:creator: Helmut Ruhland

item.title: Universal quasiconformal trees
item.description: arXiv:2411.01726v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: A quasiconformal tree is a doubling (compact) metric tree in which the diameter of each arc is comparable to the distance of its endpoints. We show that for each integer $n\geq 2$, the class of all quasiconformal trees with uniform branch separation and valence at most $n$, contains a quasisymmetrically "universal" element, that is, a an element of this class in which every other element can be embedded quasisymmetrically. We also show that every quasiconformal tree with uniform branch separation quasisymmetrically embeds into $\mathbb{R}^2$. Our results answer two questions of Bonk and Meyer from 2022 and partially answer one question of Bonk and Meyer from 2020.
item.dc:creator: Efstathios Konstantinos Chrontsios Garitsis, Fotis Ioannidis, Vyron Vellis

item.title: Substitution tilings with transcendental inflation factor
item.description: arXiv:2208.01327v3 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: For any $\lambda>2$, we construct a substitution on an infinite alphabet which gives rise to a substitution tiling with inflation factor $\lambda$. In particular, we obtain the first class of examples of substitutive systems with transcendental inflation factors that possess usual dynamical properties enjoyed by primitive substitutions on finite alphabets. We show that both the associated subshift and tiling dynamical systems are strictly ergodic, which is related to the quasicompactness of the underlying substitution operator. We also provide an explicit substitution with transcendental inflation factor $\lambda$.
item.dc:creator: Dirk Frettl\"oh, Alexey Garber, Neil Ma\~nibo

item.title: A Rogers--Brascamp--Lieb--Luttinger inequality in the space of matrices
item.description: arXiv:2309.13298v4 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: We consider convex bodies in $M_{n,m}(\mathbb R)$, the space of matrices of $n$-rows and $m$-columns. A special case of fiber-symmetrization in $M_{n,m}(\mathbb R)$ was recently introduced in [5,6]. We prove a Rogers--Brascamp--Lieb--Luttinger type inequality with respect to this symmetrization, for quasi-concave functions and provide some applications.
item.dc:creator: Juli\'an Haddad
